required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Safety and Efficacy of Carbon Dioxide (CO2) Acupulse Laser Treatment on Urinary Stress Incontinence.
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Safety and Efficacy of CO2 Acupulse Laser Treatment on Women With Urinary Stress Incontinence.

brief_summary.textblock: The study is intended to assess the safety and efficacy of CO2 AcuPulse laser treatment in patients with urinary stress incontinence (USI). Eligible subjects will receive 3 treatment sessions, 4 weeks apart and 3 Follow Up visits, at 1, 3, and 6 months following the last treatment.

detailed_description.textblock:
Following a screening visit and a urodynamic test, eligible subjects will be enrolled into the study. Eligibility will be decided depending on the level of USI the patient has. Each subject will receive 3 treatments 4 weeks apart and 3 Follow Up visits, at 1, 3, and 6 months following the last treatment.
Further demographic information and patient history will be obtained from the subjects` electronical files.

primary_outcome.measure: The change in USI symptoms as measured by cough test
The change in USI symptoms as measured using quality of life questionnaires at the follow-up visits compared to baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Subject assessment of pain and discomfort that is procedure related using a Pain Visual Analogue Scale (VAS), evaluated at each treatment.
Adverse events (AE's) and serious adverse events (SAE's).

arm_group.description: Subjects with USI as diagnosed in urodynamic testing intended to receive 3 treatments 4 weeks apart and 3 Follow Up visits, at 1, 3, and 6 months following the last treatment.

intervention.description: Each subject will receive 3 treatments 4 weeks apart and 3 Follow Up visits, at 1, 3, and 6 months following the last treatment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Negative urine culture.
- Positive for USI in urodynamic testing.
- Normal Papanicolaou (PAP) test from the recent year.
- Negative for vaginal wall prolapse.
- Able and willing to comply with the treatment/follow-up schedule and requirements.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant subjects.
- Subjects with repeated urinary tract infections or repeated infections with Candida or Herpes (more than twice a year).
- Previous surgery in the treatment area in the previous 9 months.
- Unexplained vaginal bleeding.
